intro: Urera viridisetosa, commonly known as the green-hairy urera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, green pubescence. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and are borne on slender pedicels. Urera viridisetosa is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
